meanings.definition: Not lessened or diminished in intensity or severity.
meanings.sent1: The unallayed storm raged on, with no sign of weakening.
meanings.sent2: Her unallayed fear of spiders made it difficult for her to enter the dark basement.
meanings.sent3: The unallayed excitement of the children on the playground was contagious.
meanings.sent4: His unallayed determination to succeed drove him to work harder than anyone else.
meanings.sent5: The unallayed pain in his heart felt like a heavy weight dragging him down.

meanings.sent1: The unallayed tension in the room made it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent2: Despite his efforts, the unallayed stress continued to weigh heavily on him.
meanings.sent3: The unallayed itch on his back was driving him crazy.
meanings.sent4: Her unallayed hunger gnawed at her stomach relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: The unallayed sorrow in her eyes was evident to everyone who saw her.

meanings.sent1: The unallayed baby's cries echoed through the house.
meanings.sent2: His unallayed anger towards his boss was affecting his work performance.
meanings.sent3: The unallayed noise from the construction site disrupted the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: Her unallayed frustration with the situation was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The unallayed chaos in the classroom made it difficult for the teacher to regain control.
